result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mecos Maqunn Harness

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mecos Maqunn Harness appeared by video.  Attorney Jaymes K. Fenton appeared by video for Mecos Maqunn Harness.  Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD.
Status conference held. Defendant needs to complete the TAD evaluation for possible DPA entry. Case adjourned to Branch 1.
Status conference scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Mecos Maqunn Harness appeared by video.  Attorney Jaymes K. Fenton appeared by video for Mecos Maqunn Harness.  
Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Hearing held via Zoom.  Status conference held.  Atty. Fenton has not received an offer and requests another status date. Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed; forwarded to the Judge for signature

Defendant Mecos Maqunn Harness in court.  Prosecuting attorney Michael J. Odden in court for the State of Wisconsin. Hearing held via zoom. Indigency hearing proceeded.  Court makes a finding that defendant is indigent.  Court appoints Jay Fenton as counsel for defendant at the rate of $100.00 per hour.  Attorney Fenton accepts appointment.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate of $100.00 on the 1st of every month, commencing 10/01/2022 until paid in full. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Case is adjourned in Branch 01. This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Mecos Maqunn Harness in court.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 1.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 8/3/22 @ 1:30p
